questions.question_text:
You are a help desk representative for an organization using Dynamics 365 Customer Service.
Users need to search within the system for similar cases. None of the out-of-the-box settings have been changed.
You need to determine which search features are available for use by default.
Which two search features are available? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

You are a Dynamics 365 Customer Service administrator.
You need to add a new status reason to the case entity.
What are two possible ways to accomplish the goal? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.C: Create a new solution and add the existing Case entity. Select Status Reason and add a new value.
choices.A: Navigate to Cases in the Customer Service Hub app. Open a record, edit the form, and then edit the Status reason field.
choices.B: Modify the existing solution and the case entity. Edit the status reason and add an additional status reason value.
choices.D: Modify the existing solution. Add another entity named Status. Then, create a status reason field with additional options.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
I belive B C is correct!

comments.content: Maybe you don't have an existing solution with the Case entity inside it and don't want to work out of the default solution. B & C are the correct answers here.
A is not correct, because you can't edit the form nor fields from Cases in the Customer Service Hub.

discussion.content: I believe it's A & B. Why would you (C) create a new solution? Makes no sense to me. A & B are the most logical imho. Cheers

comments.content: because you are working with the case entity not status

discussion.content: I believe this is correct! BC
I think the given answers are correct.

questions.question_text:
You set a default entitlement for a customer.
You need to ensure that the default entitlement is automatically associated with a case.
What are two possible ways to achieve this goal? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: A and B are correct because after creating a case you can asociate entitelments autmaticaly for contacts (have rigt to create a ticket), products (entitelment for a certain product) and customers.

I would say A and C. When you create a new Case and when the Case is updated. My guess is that setting different references (B) does not count as updating a Case.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-service/create-entitlement-define-support-terms-customer?tabs=customerserviceadmincenter

I think A and B because only the default entitlement is associated automatically. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/creating-and-managing-entitlements-in-dynamics-365/4-additional-considerations

comments.content: Agreed with B&D. Adding activity can deduct the entitlement channel items.

discussion.content:
I would rather say it is B and C : "In a case record, in the Entitlement field, select the Lookup button,and select an entitlement. The inline lookup shows only the active entitlement for the customer of the case.
The Entitlements section in the case record lists all the active entitlements for the customer."
